text: I Think About You is the fourth studio album released by American country music artist Collin Raye. Released in 1995 on Epic Records, I Think About You was also Raye's fourth consecutive album to receive a platinum certification by the RIAA. The album produced the singles "I Think About You", "Not That Different", "On the Verge", "One Boy, One Girl", "Love Remains" and "What If Jesus Comes Back Like That". These latter two tracks were the first two singles of Raye's career to miss the Top Ten on the Billboard country charts since his 1991 debut single, "All I Can Be (Is a Sweet Memory)". ==Track listing== #"I Think About You" (Don Schlitz, Steve Seskin) – 3:27 #"Not That Different" (Karen Taylor-Good, Joie Scott) – 3:56 #"On the Verge" (Hugh Prestwood) – 3:49 #"One Boy, One Girl" (Mark Alan Springer, Shaye Smith) – 4:03 #"Sweet Miss Behavin'" (Kostas, Wally Wilson) – 2:14 #"Heart Full of Rain" (Prestwood) – 3:53 #"What If Jesus Comes Back Like That" (Pat Bunch, Doug Johnson) – 3:07 #"The Time Machine" (Gary Burr) – 3:41 #"I Love Being Wrong" (Billy Kirsch, John Jarrard) – 4:17 #"I Volunteer" (Larry Boone, Will Robinson, Tammy Hyler) – 3:09 #"Love Remains" (Tom Douglas, Jim Daddario) – 3:48 ==Chart performance== {| class="wikitable" ! Chart (1995) !
